locations.name: Toronto
locations.description: Toronto, the capital of the province of Ontario, is a major Canadian city along Lake Ontario’s northwestern shore. It's a dynamic metropolis with a core of soaring skyscrapers, all dwarfed by the iconic, free-standing CN Tower. Toronto also has many green spaces, from the orderly oval of Queen’s Park to 400-acre High Park and its trails, sports facilities and zoo

attractions.name: CN Tower
attractions.description: A must-visit landmark with stunning city views.

attractions.name: Royal Ontario Museum
attractions.description: Explore art, culture, and natural history.

attractions.name: Distillery District
attractions.description: Experience history, art, and vibrant entertainment.

locations.name: Vancouver
locations.description: Vancouver, a bustling west coast seaport in British Columbia, is among Canada’s densest, most ethnically diverse cities. A popular filming location, it’s surrounded by mountains, and also has thriving art, theatre and music scenes. Vancouver Art Gallery is known for its works by regional artists, while the Museum of Anthropology houses preeminent First Nations collections.

attractions.name: Stanley Park
attractions.description: Enjoy nature and outdoor activities in the heart of the city.

attractions.name: Gastown
attractions.description: Explore historic charm, shops, and restaurants.

attractions.name: Granville Island
attractions.description: Discover a vibrant public market and cultural hub.

locations.name: Montreal
locations.description: Montreal is the largest city in the province of Quebec.

attractions.name: Old Montreal
attractions.description: Experience the historic charm and cobblestone streets.

attractions.name: Mont-Royal
attractions.description: Enjoy outdoor activities and panoramic views from the mountain.

attractions.name: Notre-Dame Basilica
attractions.description: Marvel at the stunning Gothic Revival architecture.
